Module.ModuleTitle: Introduction to History, Law, Politics and Philosophy
Module.ModuleSearchKeywords: ESPS, INTELLECTUAL HISTORY, POLITICAL PHILOSOPHY, POLITICS, EPISTEMOLOGY, RATIONALITY, LAW, EU LAW
Module.ModuleSuperGroup: Introduction to History, Law, Politics and Philoso

ModuleInstance.ModuleInstanceDescription: This is the first year core module for ESPS students and affiliates, and a wide-ranging and challenging humanities/social science module for non-ESPS students, giving an introduction to concepts and theories central to the understanding of modern European politics, history, law and thought. It is divided into seven main sections: - Political Science I: Key Issues and Problems in Politics - Law -History I: History of Political Thought - Political Science II: Challenges to the State in World Politics - History II: Explaining Modernity - Political Science III: Political Economy - Philosophy. - Guest lectures from other disciplines will also be given. Available to: Affiliates and all years from other departments (compulsory for ESPS first years) Prerequisites: None, but students not taking an ESPS degree should note the disciplinary range of this module.
ModuleInstance.ModuleInstanceRestriction: This is a core module for 1st year BA ESPS/ISPS students. It is only available to students on other degrees in exceptional circumstances. Please contact j.wagner@ucl.ac.uk
